SANDISK CRUZER BLADE 16 GB PENDRIVE REVIEW
You get what you pay for...
review:
THE GOOD: Reliable brand, acceptable read speeds averaging at 32MB/s
(considering it's USB2), stability check passes with no errors (see attached
screenshot), have another 8GB cruzerblade that's been used for like 2 whole
years and it still performs as new- hope this will turn out to be as durable.  
  
THE BAD: Slow write speed. The device writes at 4 to 6 MB/s maximum (using a
Windows 10 laptop with i7 5500U CPU, Nvidia GTX 940M GPU, and 16GB RAM, with
the drive plugged in a USB 3 port). The drive tends to heat up during
operation which my older cruzerblade doesn't. The older 8GB cruzerblade stays
cool even when used constantly for moving data (hours at a time), but this new
drive heats up within 10 minutes of ANY read/write operation using the same
pair of computers. The good news (I guess) is that I have an HP w220v flash
drive and that heats up as well- it's been heating up for like 4 years, and it
still works- heat will probably not damage the device (unless it's heating
like a stove,, which it isn't).  
  
THE UGLY: The seller called me and asked me to cancel the order, claiming his
warehouse has burned down and if he cancels the order on his own he will be
"fined" by Amazon for not fulfilling his commitment. This is very weird- I've
been shopping online for years and no seller has ever called me up. I called
Amazon to check, Amazon customer care asked me not to cancel the order. I did
not cancel and the product was eventually delivered (before promised date).
This was an unique incident, and the chances of this repeating with your order
is infinitesimally small.  
  
USABLE CAPACITY: 14.5 GB  
  
BOTTOM LINE: At this price, you cannot lose. Even if it goes bad, SanDisk is a
genuine brand and it comes with a 5 years warranty- you can always call up
SanDisk and request assistance. Go for it.

Hi Everyone, Today i am gonna review  
Sandisk Cruzer Blade 16gb , Purchased on 10th August,2017 AT 349INR.  
I TESTED it properly Here is my Full Review.  
  
Build Quality of this product : 2.5 * out of 5. ( Plastic Port is too thin)  
  
Quality of the Product : 3* out of 5.  
  
Transfer Rate : 3* out of 5. ( 4-5 mb/ps)  
  
Value for money : 4* out of 5.(cheapest in 16gb categories)  
  
ADVANTAGES :  
  
I gave 4* for Value for money. Because  
  
1- It is around 350 rupees in 16 gb..may be the cheapest.  
  
2- 5 years warranty / Garente .  
  
3- Light weight. Easy to carry.  
  
4- No heating Issues.  
  
Problem of this Product / Suggestions if you already brought it :  
  
1- Transfer rate is average . Starting with 40 mb/ps to it reduce to 3.5mb/ps.
And the average is 4-5mb/ps. Which is little slow.  
  
2- You have to be careful always because the port build quality is very very
thin. It may break with little force also. use wisely.  
  
3- Not suitable For heavy users. Those who always use for heavy transfer ,
sorry this pendrive is not for you. Especially college guys. Try HP 16gb .  
  
4- you have to keep it carefully ,if you will get a crack on this your
warranty will not be accepted. Too thin .  
  
5- Use Only for minimum purposes .just like for print out a document. Or some
e books.  
So for Office Purpose its okey. Students are heavy users .They always transfer
Games, Movies etc etc. so Big no for them. Spend a little more and get Hp one,
you will get more transfer speed...you will be happy. But for Office use or
minimum users this product is best at this price.  
  
Overall My Rating is 3*. It could have been more good if the transfer rate
would be little higher. 4-5 mb/ps speed is not good at all. Just an average.  
  
Thanks guys for Reading my Reveiw .Have a beautiful day ahead. Jai 🇮🇳.

This pendrive just got an amazing ability of transferring the data at a very
high speed. It is the most affordable and also premium pendrive under the
range of 400 with 16 gb internal storage out of which you get about 14-15 gb.
It gives a haptic feedback to me and also it is offered from SanDisk the most
trusted company. It is compatible with Windows 10 also which is an amazing
thing. It is very small so you can carry it in your short pocket. It also
comes with 2 years warranty so you don't have to worry about it. Below is a
brief description about it so that you can get it better.  
  
Description :-  
Product description The SanDisk 16GB Cruzer Blade USB Flash Drive from SanDisk
is a compact, portable USB flash drive. It allows you to carry and transfer
files on the go like photos, videos or music files to share with family and
friends. Easily share files between computers with this convenient USB flash
drive. From the Manufacturer Generous Capacity with Compact and Upscale Design
SanDisk Cruzer Blade 16GB USB 2.0 flash drive boasts a classy compact design
featuring a large data storage capacity. Now you can conveniently backup,
transfer, share and carry your favourite media like movies, music, video clips
or pictures with you everywhere you go. The pocket-size design of the SanDisk
16GB pendrive facilitates easy and comfortable portability letting you carry
your personal data with you to school or work, while its built-in SanDisk
Secure Access software keeps any unauthorised access of your personal data at
bay by enabling you to store your files in a password-protected folder.
SanDisk Cruzer Blade is an excellent choice for users looking for a storage
option to carry their important data with them even while on the move. Just
Drag-and-Drop to Backup Your Data We all love to carry our stuff with us
everywhere we go. From our favourite music to an important office
presentation, portability of data is a necessity in today's fast-moving world.
With the SanDisk Cruzer Blade Flash Drive, transferring data onto it is a
breeze. The SanDisk 16GB flash drive comes with a simple Drag-and-Drop
feature, which lets you drag-and-drop files into your drive conveniently after
plugging it into the USB port of your laptop or desktop. After a quick, one-
time driver download, you can easily store, share and transfer your personal
data in a flash. Capacity: 16GB Interface: USB v2.0 Security: Password
protected folder, 128-bit AES Encryption Warranty: 2 years  
  
So this is my review for this hope this will help you in purchasing it. If it
helped please vote this review helpful.

≧◉◡◉≦ Hello ≧◉◡◉≦  
  
• INTRODUCTION •  
  
I purchased this product a week ago. The delivery service and the seller's
service do deserve special compliments. This works perfectly and awesomely.
This one really is a great product. Especially when having a price tag of
₹285.00. Through my constant experiments on this “SanDisk Cruzer Blade
SDCZ50-016G-135 16GB USB 2.0 Pen Drive”, I had came to some inferences. I'm
sharing that info with you all through this review.  
I'm expressing my views about this product point-by-point and will try my best
to shorten it. So that, you could grasp the idea in it simply and easily.  
“All the views expressed in this review are solely my own.”  
  
• PROS •  
  
√. Cool, stylish and compact design.  
√. Very handy.  
√. Less weight (9 grams).  
√. Dimension [size] is perfect (5.6 x 3.6 x 1 cm).  
√. Will fit in your pockets.  
√. So comfortable to use.  
√. The Black & Red combination is very cool.  
√. Back up, sharing and transferring files is now in your hands.  
√. Now you can carry your essentials, wherever you go.  
√. Made up of plastic material.  
√. Shows enough speed as expected (USB v2.0).  
√. Easy to share files between computers, laptops, etc.  
√. Also, you are able to share the files with your tablets or smartphones,
with the support of an otg adapter.  
√. Comes up with a built-in SanDisk Secure Access software.  
√. This product has 5 years manufacturer warranty.  
√. Worth every penny, you spend to buy it.  
  
• CONS •  
  
x. No light indicators.  
x. Continues use of about 10 minutes or more will start to produce heat in it.  
x. Connector is made up of plastic material (careless use may broke it), not
made of metal.  
x. This only comes with a USB v2.0 interface.  
  
• VERDICT •  
  
This product is so cool & comfy to use. The colour combination is the one
that, highly attracted me. I really appreciate SanDisk for introducing the
built-in security application in their pendrive(s). The size, shape, design
amd all such things needs special compliments. All the PROS makes this small
one a big one.  
Now saying about the CONS; don't expect a 'notification light' feature, for
this price tag. The connector part (plastic material) may broke, if it is used
carelessly. So, give care to that thing. This product is with USB v2.0
interface, which is getting outdated. Technology has gone a long way, and so
SanDisk too. So, now pendrives with higher interface is available. If you need
high speed, I would probably suggest you to go for higher interfaces (such USB
v3.0 or USB v3.1). The one that I hated the most, in this item is the 'heating
problem' in it. I think, SanDisk might have forgotten to focus on that aspect.
And also, I hope that, SanDisk will fix a ‘band-aid’ to that problem in the
future.  
Except the CONS, the product is one big piece of mass. I personally like this
product a lot. This product is just enough, to satisfy your needs to store
your essential files.

SanDisk Cruzer Blade 16 GB USB 2.0 Pen Drive : Does it's job well!  
  
Writing this review after 1.5 years of usage. I also have a 8 GB Cruzer Blade
which I have been using since years.  
Data Transfer Speed is as below,  
Read Speed:20-22 MB/sec  
Write Speed:8-9 MB/sec  
  
PROS  
-Reliable, no loss of data so far.  
-Stylish & ergonomic design, which helps in gripping the pendrive while inserting into or removing from the usb port.  
-Pocket friendly, weightless & small in size.  
-Comes with Sandisk Secure Access software inbuilt.  
-Economical compared to other brands.  
-No cap, so actually no worries about losing it.  
-Best suited for using in music systems or TVs.  
-Full HD videos works flawlessly while using in TV.  
-All plastic body, doesn't get heated as fast as metal ones.  
-Hole is provided, so that you can attach your pendrive to the keyring or string.  
  
CONS  
-Data writing speed is too slow.  
-The end connector is highly prone to break, as its plastic, I have seen many Cruzer Blades broken like that.  
-Not good for quick file transfers.  
-Not for rough use, unlike metal ones.  
-No light for data transfer indication, which is not really important for me though.  
-Not recommended for making bootable drives.  
  
OVERVIEW  
-If you are not looking for a high performance pendrive, instead a budget one, which is reliable and robust enough, especially for the data storage purpose with only intermittent data transfers, just go for Sandisk.  
  
Happy Shopping :)

The read and write speeds are quite average but we get to use only 14.3 GB of
the allotted 16 Gb,  
The flash drive is relatively small in size and quite handy to carry around
but the Kingston Data Traveler with a ring at one end to club it with a key
chain makes more sense.  
Sandisk Cruzer Blade out of the box is formatted with FAT32 partition so
unless you have devices that accept only FAT32, it is better to convert it to
NTFS to ensure better speeds.  
Since it is the basic version of SanDisk, it works well within it's price
range, but if performance is what you want, go for Ultra or above.

I purchased this 16GB on 21st August 2014 at the price of 370rs. It was the
cheapest pendrive available at that time. I use this pendrive regularly for
copying movies, installing softwares and OS etc. I partitioned the drives for
installing kali linux as live. And recovered the pendrive. So after these
heavy usage also this works fine. It did't show me an error message till this
day.  
  
Speed :  
I tested the speed of the pendrive in my Macbook pro and attached the
screenshot. It shows me 8mb/s for writing and 23mb/s for reading the data.
It's not bad. You will get 4-10mb/s as write speed.  
  
At this cost this pendrive gives lot of advantages. You can buy without having
a second mind.  
If you want more speed than this,then you can go for USB 3.0 drives.

Not upto mark

Sandisk is a leading company in the Secondary Storage device.  
I am using this pendrive long time. Now I want to review this product so that
buyers can decide.  
Pros:  
1\. This is very light weight and small in size that you can carry everywhere.  
2\. There is a dedicated gap for key chains so that it can not be lost.  
3\. It has a premium Look of Sandisk  
4\. You have Sandisk Secure Manager in this pendrive. ( I recommend you to use
this as it is most secured I think).  
5\. Reading speed is awesome 18.5MB/s  
6\. Writing Speed is almost 9.5 MB/s  
7\. The Long Warranty Period is awesome.  
8\. Easy to format whether in NTFS or in FAT32, I recommend you to use FAT32
Default , but while using in Windows Installation you can use the NTFS format.  
9\. It is supported in Set Top Box, (I have tested in Government Provided Set
Top Box to record shows)  
10\. The Branding of Sanding makes it awesome.  
  
Cons:  
1\. It has a plastic body, so please use it carefully while plugging in..  
2\. One of my Sandisk Pendrive is broken as I have pressured to put it in USB
Drive, so be carefull.  
3\. After using many days, while reading from pendrive or writing from
pendrive you will feel the pendrive little warm, but it is normal I think.  
4\. If you have accidentally deleted the Sandisk Secure Manager software, it
is hard to find it, so please be careful.  
  
Otherwise this product is awesome, You can surely Go for it. Thank You, I
think this review helped you a lot. Hit the "HELPFUL" button if you think that
it helped you to decide about this product. Thank You for viewing this review.

SanDisk is one of the best selling USB drives of our times due to its robust
nature added with the perk of never breaking down in its job. This product too
upholds the characteristics which made SanDisk one of the most sought brands.  
  
Following the trend, this device too performs extremely well, has decent speed
and does not create any nuisance. However, owing to the material used in the
body, it is very likely to crack if not taken an extra bit of care.  
  
If you are using it for everyday work with no-so-valuable data, this is a
sureshot device to target. It is to kept in mind, if you squeeze this product
in your wallet asking it to play with the coins in it, this device is sure to
break.

I bought this pen drive from amazon and got this within 3 days!!!!! The pen
drive was packed compactly,as expected from amazon  
Now about the pen drive. Here are its pros and cons.  
  
Pros:  
1)Small size  
2)Superb looks  
3)No cap. If there was one and it is lost, then it will really be a problem.
But this one doesn't have one. So good  
4)It's a Sandisk  
5)Good Transfer Speed. I get about 19 to 20Mbps. Those who complain about low
transfer speed, try formatting the pen drive from FAT32 to NTFS to increase
the speed. At FAT32 I only get about 5 to 6Mbps while in NTFS, as I have
mentioned above about 19 to 20Mbps  
6) I like the Sandisk Secure Access Software  
  
Cons:  
1)Only 14.9 gigs of storage.(But can live with it!)  
2)Average Build Quality.  
  
But the Cons are outweighed by the benefits of this product.  
I'm satisfied with this pen drive  
  
So if you are looking for good performance and awesome looks, go for it.

review:
Bought it during sale but paid pretty much the same amount as i would have
without the sale.  
Next coming to the product  
1\. works no issues there,  
2\. read and write speeds are as they should be - Never expect the highest
speeds that are written as that depends on may other factors,  
3\. the drive itself is extremely tight at this point maybe it will loosen up
after constant use. This is not a bad or good thing for me personally its a
bit of a nuisance to have to pull it with force  
4\. the only CON i found was heating - It heats up regardless of the size of
data transfer. I transfer a 56kb image it heats up, i transfer 400 mb it heats
up.  
  
Do not know if this is gonna cause issues in the future because this is the
first flash drive that has heating issues that i have used.  
If i had an infra red camera i would should you in pictures but i don't have
that.

I have been using a similar drive of 4GB capacity from last 2 years. The drive
was purchased for my office and its working absolutely fine with several
writes each day. I was using this drive to test the software developed for our
office product where I had to write huge amount of machine data every 1 hour.
The tests were done for almost 3 months. The drive is still working fine after
so much of writes.  
  
The plastic quality is bit cheap and the USB socket is prone to break quite
easily as the corners of the plastic are very slim. All in all, if you use it
wisely and does not get it crushed beneath heavy objects, it will work
superbly.  
Read and Write speeds are well for a normal day to day work. Nothing special
in it, but its build to last electronically quite a few years.  
  
Being a satisfied user of the 4GB version which was for office use, I ordered
a personal one of 16GB just recently because I had to consume the amount in my
prepaid card.  
  
If you are looking for simple, build to last (functionality wise), for day-to-
day copy needs, normal size of data transfers, go for it.  
If you want metallic finish, robust build quality, or a large data transfer
every now and then, look for Kingston Drives. They are tough in structure, but
R/W speeds are less compared to similarly priced products.

received the two 16gb and 8gb pen drives within two days where a sunday fell
in the middle ,well in time as always! the fine packaging by SanDisk merely
required a bubbles pack which Amazon provided. the product is super. why i
didn't have two 16gb drives ? Amazon didn't allowed ! so here we go from box
to operation (for old buddies) ; 1.receive delivery, open package ,find the
product ,check its code and accept the product (and make the payment) 2.cut it
with the scissor marks only (and don't spoil the packing, it can be used for a
long time) and with the help of the two finger ,with a little care and trick,
take it out. 3.Pc's anti virus ready for a removable drive scan, pc connected
to internet for latest driver installation and automatic installation is
active in device installation settings. 4 then insert it into the usb 2.0 port
gently with the name SanDisk on the top. 5 within seconds ''the driver is
installed and device is ready to use" message appears. 6 now, antivirus scans
it and hopefully its clear. 7.now check it for the errors. right click upon
the sandisk/pen drive icon and go to properties at bottom and click it. my 16
gb pendrive shows capacity as 14.5gb (EFFECTIVE)! 8.move to the next section
'TOOLS' at the top and go for the "Check now' (radio) button and hopefully,
everything is good. 9.now the pendrive can be used for storage purposes. make
at least a single folder in the pendrive,preferably. now drag any item from
any location window and drop to the new folder window in the pendrive or just
copy and paste. 10 additionally, in the Property box, there is also a tab
'ReadyBoost" (wow ! my pc has checked the device and found that it can be used
for ready boost! when its only USB 2.0 ! ) readyboost can really boost your
system with HDD and low RAM. the box further asks you to dedicate the pendrive
for readyboost or allot at least 4gb = 4096mb for the readyboost to work
effectively or not to use it for readyboost at all ! if you don't want to use
it for readyboost, just don't do there anything in the readyboost tab. Mind
that the space you allocate for readyboost can't be used for storage purposes.
you can use 32 gb for readyboost @ maximum on each pen drive and you can add 8
such pendrives @ max to a single Pc. 11.apart from storage and readyboost,
these usb drives can also be made bootable. i mean you can also use them to
install windows,etc or start a pc with them.etc, etc. Believe me installing
windows,etc with pendrives is a lot faster than with a installation dvd and
where pen drive's life is 5 year and we all know about a dvd's life. all the
more external/ internal dvd writers life is hardly two years now a days. an
external dvd writer in the price band of 1500/- to 2000/- is mostly assured of
1 year life (only TRANSCEND assures 2 year life in that price band). what we
have to do is just find a suitable installer for an app .there are tools to
make multiboot pendrives. RAYMOND CC is a very good search site for advance
uses which is secured by NORTON and provides a lot of safe download sites
which you can instantly check with VIRUS TOTAL! 12. back to our task , check
the drive for ten days return period and then register it with SanDisk and get
a 5 year warranty/ guarantee.13 CAUTION: dont just pullout the pendrive to
detach it from Pc ! data loss may happen. always remove removable storage
safely. there will be a a green lock in the 'Task Bar' @ bottom and near the
right corner of the desktop.and when you hover mouse pointer/cursor over it,
it would say 'safely remove hardware'. click it and a small box would say
'safely remove USB Mass storage device' with the listing of removable drives.
There you have to select the drive and click it. then a window will appear
saying 'this device can now be safely removed from the computer' then you have
to pull it out gently. otherwise there will be a message window saying that
'the device cannot be detached' or 'some program is still using the device' or
something like that. in that case make it sure that no program is using that
for eg copying , scanning, etc. finish the process(s) , save your work, come
out and again start from the green lock. if you are not able to make out where
it is being used or opened, don't panic but also don't pull it out. keep on
doing what you are doing save all your work and do a complete shut down and
then you can detach it with no fear. additionally, as i know if you are using
it for readyboost, it would not be detachable in the middle and not even try
to do that ! 14. i forgot to mention that there is also a special option in
the product. you can encrypt your data on it. it means you can block access to
that data by other users. therefore SanDisk has put one application Executable
and one guide PDF (for the use of that application) on the pen drive. that PDF
is for windows users. and mac users can download guide straight from the
second PDF. i think its more useful for storage purposes. THANKS.

Bought this for using it on my LED TV. The packaging and delivery was good.
Tested on Windows 7. The OS recognized the device immediately and installed
the drivers automatically without any fuss. Comes bundled with sandisk secure
access software. I don't know if i will ever use it. There is a perforation to
tie a lanyard, but no cap on to protect the USB head. The read speed was
around 28 MB/s and write speed was 9 MB/s.  
Tried on my TV, and 1080P HD videos(mkv format appx 2 GB and mp4 format appx 4
GB) played without any lag. Good for normal household use.

Hello Buyers,  
Before going to this review, I try my best to give my review for this product
. I buy this pendrive before 10 days. I really enjoy with this pendrive at
this price range. As this is a usb 2.0 (DDR3 SD)pendrive it transfers file
upto the speed of 40-50 Mbps in my pc. This is quite good for usb 2.0 pendrive
particullary with this price range. Also speaking with its built quality i
dropped 5 or 6 times at a height of around 50 ft but this pendrive works for
me perfectly without any scratches. I feel good to recommmend this pendrive
for all peoples. You also feels happy with this pendrive performance.. Hope
this review is helpful, If you find this helpful hit the helpful button too!  
  
Buy AT : SanDisk Cruzer Blade SDCZ50-016G-135 16GB USB 2.0 Pen Drive

Working fine after almost one and a half years, So I guess it's quite good pen
drive. Max read speed is around 20~22 MBps and write speed sucks, depends on
file size and number of files etc, I've seen it doing 0.5~5MBps, but that's
close enough to USB 2.0 standards. Buy it if you don't plug it into PC every
other minute.  
  
The plastic body isn't that strong and plugging point has to be handed
carefully while inserting into port but it has lasted fairly rough plug-in
/plug-outs so quite durable I guess.

It may be easy om the pocket but it feels really clumsy . Made entirely from
plastic. Every time you insert it in a laptop you will be paying that it won't
break into pieces..  
  
You might want to see the review pictures to see the scratches on the surface
after using it a just a day!  
  
Pros :  
1\. Cheap,  
2.highest capacity in it's price range  
  
Cons:  
1\. Really weak body made with plastic entirely  
2.USB 2.0 hence transfer super is very slow(but what more can you expect at
this price)
